item.title: How to query JSON in MySQL with JSON_CONTAINS
item.description:
You can query a JSON document in MySQL to find content within it with:

  • The JSON_CONTAINS function that will return if a JSON document is contained within another JSON document. The function returns 1 if the document is contained, 0 elsewhere.
  • The JSON_CONTAINS function that will return if a JSON document path is contained within another JSON document. The function returns 1 if the document is contained, 0 elsewhere.

item.title: How to tabulate a JSON document in MySQL
item.description: You can tabulate a JSON document (retrieve it as a row) in MySQL with the JSON_TABLE function.

item.title: How to remove a field in a JSON document in MySQL
item.description: You can remove a field from JSON document in MySQL with the JSON_REMOVE function.

item.title: How to insert a field in a JSON document in MySQL
item.description: You can insert a field in a JSON document in MySQL with the JSON_INSERT function.

item.title: How to edit a JSON document in MySQL
item.description:
You can edit a JSON document in MySQL with:

  • The JSON_SET function that will replace values for JSON paths that exists and add values for the ones that don’t exist.
  • The JSON_REPLACE function that will replace values for JSON paths that exists and ignore the ones that don’t exist.

item.title: How to merge JSON documents in MySQL
item.description:
You can merge two JSON documents in MySQL with:

  • the JSON_MERGE_PRESERVE function to concatenate the document values
  • the JSON_MERGE_PATCH function to keep the latest value for each key

item.title: How to create a JSON document from fields in MySQL
item.description: You can create a JSON document from fields in Mysql® with the JSON_OBJECT function

item.title: How to get the JSON field types in MySQL
item.description: To get the type of a JSON item in MySQL you need to use the JSON_TYPE function.

item.title: How to extract an item from an array in a JSON object in MySQL
item.description: To extract an item from an array in MySQL you need to use the -> operator and the [item_number] JSON Path Syntax.

item.title: How to extract a field from a JSON object in MySQL
item.description:
MySQL® offers three ways to extract fields from a JSON object:

  • the -> operator to extract the field as JSON
  • the ->> operator to extract the field as text
  • the JSON_EXTRACT function

Both operators use the JSON Path Syntax
